data.author: Paul Krugman
data.quotation: Simple doesn't mean stupid. Thinking that it does, does.

data.author: Uncle Bob Martin
data.quotation: A consistent lexicon is a great boon to the programmers who must use your code.

data.author: Grace Hopper
data.quotation: If it's a good idea, go ahead and do it. It is much easier to apologize than it is to get permission.

data.author: Brian Kernighan
data.quotation: An effective way to test code is to exercise it at its natural boundaries.

data.author: C.A.R. Hoare
data.quotation: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.

data.author: Peter Landin
data.quotation: Most papers in computer science describe how their author learned what someone else already knew.

data.author: Joyce Wheeler
data.quotation: Sometimes it's better to leave something alone, to pause, and that's very true of programming.

data.author: Jason Gorman
data.quotation: Refuctoring - the process of taking a well-designed piece of code and, through a series of small, reversible changes, making it completely unmaintainable by anyone except yourself.

data.author: Christopher Thompson
data.quotation: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday's code.

data.author: Ellen Ullman
data.quotation: Software engineering is not about right and wrong but only better and worse.

data.author: Alan Perlis
data.quotation: If you have a procedure with ten parameters, you probably missed some.

data.author: John Backus
data.quotation: You need the willingness to fail all the time.

data.author: Tim Kadlec
data.quotation: Blame the implementation, not the technique.

data.author: Miguel de Icaza
data.quotation: Every piece of software written today is likely going to infringe on someone else's patent.

data.author: Bram Cohen
data.quotation: The mark of a mature programmer is willingness to throw out code you spent time on when you realize it's pointless.

data.author: David Parnas
data.quotation: Complexity is not a goal. I don't want to be remembered as an engineer of complex systems.

data.author: Tom Gilb
data.quotation: If you don't actively attack the risks, the risks will actively attack you.

data.author: Paul Graham
data.quotation: The object-oriented model makes it easy to build up programs by accretion. What this often means, in practice, is that it provides a structured way to write spaghetti code.

data.author: Stephen Johnson
data.quotation: A successful software tool is one that was used to do something undreamed of by its author.

data.author: Jim Highsmith
data.quotation: Process is not a substitute for skill.

data.author: Dan Kaminsky
data.quotation: Debugging is anticipated with distaste, performed with reluctance, and bragged about forever.

data.author: Donald Knuth
data.quotation: Computers are good at following instructions, but not at reading your mind.

data.author: Dan Bricklin
data.quotation: Sometimes the idea behind a program is one small creative effort. Just like in a short story, one little twist in the plot is the whole idea behind it.

data.author: Jeff Patton.
data.quotation: We don't need an accurate document, we need a shared understanding.

data.author: @gunnnpowder
data.quotation: Programming is another way to teach the world that the smallest, tiniest things also matter just as much. Just like when a code won't run without a semi colon.

data.author: Robert C. Martin
data.quotation: Leave the campground cleaner than the way you found it.

data.author: Michael Feathers
data.quotation: OO makes code understandable by encapsulating moving parts. FP makes code understandable by minimizing moving parts.

data.author: Jonathan Sachs
data.quotation: You can interact with a computer. And if you do it just right, you can make wonderful things happen.

data.author: Alan Perlis
data.quotation: In programming, as in everything else, to be in error is to be reborn.

data.author: Jamie Zawinski
data.quotation: To a database person, every nail looks like a thumb. Or something like that.

data.author: Gary Kildall
data.quotation: A flexible program demonstrates the difference between a good designer and someone who is just getting a piece of code out.

data.author: Niklaus Wirth
data.quotation: Reliable and transparent programs are usually not in the interest of the designer.

data.author: Bill Gates
data.quotation: If a kid is addicted to a computer, I think that's far better than watching TV, because at least his mind is making choices.

data.author: @yonatanm
data.quotation: Software craftsmanship is not about writing the perfect  piece of code. It is about continuously improving your skills, so your future code will be better.

data.author: David Leinweber
data.quotation: If you give someone a program, you will frustrate them for a day; if you teach them how to program, you will frustrate them for a lifetime.

data.author: Ken Thompson
data.quotation: No amount of source-level verification or scrutiny will protect you from using untrusted code.

data.author: Alan Turing
data.quotation: We can only see a short distance ahead, but we can see plenty there that needs to be done.

data.author: James O. Coplien
data.quotation: Objects are abstractions of processing. Threads are abstractions of schedule.

data.author: Donald Knuth
data.quotation: Premature optimisation is the root of all evil in programming.

data.author: Robert C. Martin
data.quotation: Whether you are designing systems or individual modules, never forget to use the simplest thing that can possibly work.

data.author: Fred Brooks
data.quotation: Plan to throw one away. You will, anyway.

data.author: Rich Hickey
data.quotation: What matters for simplicity is that there's not interleaving.

data.author: Damian Conway
data.quotation: Documentation is a love letter that you write to your future self.

data.author: Peter Weinberger
data.quotation: We sort of understood abstractly the idea that there are only two kinds of software projects: failures and future legacy horrors.

data.author: Ted Nelson
data.quotation: A user interface should be so simple that a beginner in an emergency can understand it within ten seconds.

data.author: @victorrentea
data.quotation: The second time you postpone refactoring a piece of code, it has become Legacy. Stand up for your Craft!

data.author: Susan Gerhart
data.quotation: One person's constant is another person's variable.

data.author: Uncle Bob
data.quotation: Produce no document unless its need is immediate and significant.

data.author: Bram Cohen
data.quotation: A good way to have good ideas is by being unoriginal.

data.author: Robert Martin
data.quotation: Would you rather Test-First or Debug-Later?

data.author: Bjarne Stroustrup
data.quotation: If someone claims to have the perfect programming language, he is either a fool or a salesman or both.

data.author: Ellen Ullman
data.quotation: The messiness cannot go into the program; it piles up around the programmer.

data.author: @ShaneCarrollMay
data.quotation: There is much more to programming than whether or not the code runs.

data.author: Gerald Weinberg
data.quotation: If builders built buildings the way programmers wrote programs, then the first woodpecker that came along wound destroy civilization.

data.author: Tim Berners-Lee
data.quotation: The Web as I envisaged it, we have not seen it yet. The future is still so much bigger than the past.

data.author: Douglas Crockford
data.quotation: It turns out that style matters in programming for the same reason that it matters in writing. It makes for better reading.

data.author: Ray Ozzie
data.quotation: I think fewer people should be shooting for the moon, and more people should be finding a niche.

data.author: Tony "Quicksort" Hoare
data.quotation: I regard it as the highest goal of programming language design to enable good ideas to be elegantly expressed.

data.author: P. J. Plauger
data.quotation: Don't stop with your first draft.

data.author: Jeff Atwood
data.quotation: Obviously we want to succeed. But on some level, success is irrelevant, because the process is inherently satisfying.

data.author: Seymour Cray
data.quotation: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it's too late.

data.author: C.A.R Hoare
data.quotation: Inside every well-written large program is a well-written small program.

data.author: Edsger Dijkstra
data.quotation: If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.

data.author: Jessica Joy Kerr
data.quotation: In programming, it's dangerous to work near your working memory threshold. You get more mistakes and more complicated code.

data.author: Roedy Green
data.quotation: The longer it takes for a bug to surface, the harder it is to find.

data.author: Rick Waldron
data.quotation: All code in any code-base should look like a single person typed it, no matter how many people contributed.

data.author: Uncle Bob
data.quotation: It is not the language that makes programs appear simple. It is the programmer that make the language appear simple!

data.author: Alan Kay
data.quotation: Simple things should be simple and complex things should be possible.

data.author: Michael A. Jackson
data.quotation: Software is only one interpretation of the reality of the problem it is solving.

data.author: David Wheeler
data.quotation: There is no problem in computer science that can't be solved using another level of indirection. But that usually will create another problem.

data.author: C.A.R. (Tony) Hoare
data.quotation: The unavoidable price of reliability is simplicity.

data.author: Meir Lehman
data.quotation: An evolving system increases its complexity unless work is done to reduce it.

data.author: Linus Torvalds
data.quotation: Any program is only as good as it is useful.

data.author: @TupleScript
data.quotation: There's nothing wrong with using others code. The essence of object-oriented programming is reusability.

data.author: Linus Torvalds
data.quotation: Bad programmers worry about the code. Good programmers worry about data structures and their relationships.

data.author: Aaron Swartz
data.quotation: Be curious. Read widely. Try new things. I think a lot of what people call intelligence boils down to curiosity.

data.author: Adam Osborne
data.quotation: The most valuable thing you can make is a mistake - you can't learn anything from being perfect.

data.author: Tom Lehrer
data.quotation: Base eight is just like base ten really, if you're missing two fingers.

data.author: Edsger Dijkstra
data.quotation: The computing scientist's main challenge is not to get confused by the complexities of his own making.

data.author: Leslie Lamport
data.quotation: Thinking doesn't guarantee that we won't make mistakes. But not thinking guarantees that we will.

data.author: Robert C. Martin
data.quotation: Abstraction is the elimination of the irrelevant and the amplification of the essential.

data.author: Steve McConnell
data.quotation: It's OK to figure out murder mysteries, but you shouldn't need to figure out code. You should be able to read it.

data.author: Donald Knuth
data.quotation: An algorithm must be seen to be believed.

data.author: Alan Turing
data.quotation: Sometimes it is the people no one can imagine anything of who do the things no one can imagine.

data.author: Robert C. Martin
data.quotation: So if you want to go fast, if you want to get done quickly, if you want your code to be easy to write, make it easy to read.

data.author: Andy Hertzfeld
data.quotation: More than anything else, what motivates me is that I want as many people as possible to use my programs.

data.author: Mike Johnson
data.quotation: Pasting code from the Internet into production code is like chewing gum found in the street.

data.author: Robert C. Martin
data.quotation: Say what you mean. Mean what you say.

data.author: Benjamin Franklin
data.quotation: If you fail to plan, you are planning to fail!

data.author: Alan Kay
data.quotation: The best way to predict the future i—ï to invent it.

data.author: Robert C. Martin
data.quotation: Code formatting is about communication, and communication is the professional developer's first order of business.

data.author: Jeremy Keith
data.quotation: Java is to JavaScript as ham is to hamster.

data.author: Donald Knuth
data.quotation: A programmer is ideally an essayist who works with traditional aesthetic & literary forms as well as mathematical concepts.

data.author: Bob Frankston
data.quotation: Reusing pieces of code is liked picking off sentences from other people's stories and trying to make a magazine article.

data.author: The Pragmatic Programmer
data.quotation: Gain familiarity with the shell, and you'll find your productivity soaring.

data.author: Ted Dziuba
data.quotation: Software development processes exist to manage the bell curve of ability in developers.

data.author: Neil McAllister
data.quotation: Programming languages move slowly, and the more popular a language is, the slower it moves.

data.author: Kyle Woodbury
data.quotation: Programming is like kicking yourself in the face, sooner or later your nose will bleed.

data.author: Jeff Atwood
data.quotation: If you don't have people that care about usability on your project, your project is doomed.

data.author: Rich Hickey
data.quotation: Most of the biggest problems in software are problems of misconception.
